p.b: Oliver ate a bowl of grickle and six sausages for breakfast.

questionBody.p: In this sentence, what could you substitute for the nonsense word grickle?

simpleChoice.p: another verb that tells what Oliver did at breakfast
another adjective that describes the sausages
another adverb that explains how Oliver ate the sausages
another noun, like sausages, that names a thing Oliver ate
